I play this game every now and again. At first I didn't like it much because you need to play a lot to get any perks that are any good and to understand how the game works. After a while I started to understand how the game works and got some perks that help not die as much. At that point the game was just barely any fun. There are matches where the killer will play extremely lame and just camp hooks after hooking someone once. If that happens you can do a few things. 1. trade yourself for the guy on the hook and possibly have the person you got off hook go right back on the hook. 2. just do generators and ignore the guy on hook. 3. leave the game. Option 3 is no longer an option as now leaving a game early will give you penalty time for trying to leave a terrible match of this not fun game. Back when option 3 was an option this game was playable, not fun but playable. Having people that camp hooks and forcing you to choose to have the perks that may allow you to save the person off the hook and maybe also get away from the killer camping, play like a rat and not play as a team mate in every game, or just not play this game. So i do not recommend that anyone plays this game unless you like grinding for perks to then grinding for decent games to play. Or just only play killer and you wont have an issue but always remember that if you play lame you can "win" really easily.
fun games to play, just the queue sometimes takes forever lol

Well, first of all, I have poured many hours into this game. Sometimes I despise playing it and sometimes I love it. If you have friends to play this with, I'd 100% say get it. If not, only if you enjoy grinding alone for hours on end. The game itself is quite nice, and is in fact an amazing concept with all of your favorite childhood horror icons as well as a few brand new ones! But, sometimes playing feels so jaunting, grindy, and forced. If you love survival horror get it, just be aware that is one of the more toxic communities in gaming from what I have seen. Now, onto the specs of the game.

It's fun to play since there's a side to be on if you're in a group or a side to be on if you're playing solo and still have a good time.

I don't think playing a survivor is rewarded enough, but overall fun game.

Edit - The most recent update to the game is *Game Breaking* most of the aspects that survivors use to slow the killer are completely broken. Also they hit boxes for survivors are about twice the size they should be now. If you are going to buy this game, it would be best to wait until after they fix these issues.

This is probably one of the worst games I've played in my life. The community is extremely toxic and this game is not friendly for new players at all. You are much better off spending your money on another game or add-on that you would enjoy. I only have played this game because of friends, but never again will I purchase this product or support this game developer for this horrible horrible game. I never had a positive experience playing this game at all, You don't have fun playing this game at all.

I'm too scared to play most horror games and personally cannot even fully watch a horror movie, but this game is worth overcoming your fears for. I have had many a scream from the bottom of my lungs and I still shit my pants when a killer pops up around a corner, yet somehow the anxiety and stress is manageable in this game and the gameplay is fun and rewarding (especially with friends).

Here is my scaredy cat resum√©:
-  in Subnautica I spent the first 20 hours never going below 200m.
- Five Nights At Freddie's I played in sheer terror against my will, only because I was playing it together with someone, and never went back to the series.
- The game Insilence I refunded after staring at the floor for the rest of the match in sheer anxiety after the first encounter.
- Amnesia I NOPED the fuck out of after encountering the first zombie creature in the mansion
- Alien Isolation took a few hours to encounter the Alien and also to realize I'd stop it there.

This game keeps me excited for new killers and ways to scare me to near-death. Highly recommend.
i have a toxic relationship with this game
